'Want to take your business messaging to the next level? Start with this simple question, Am I telling a Narrative or a Business Story?'
Are lead magnets dead? Do people even care for freebies anymore? And if they do, under what circumstances?

You might have noticed lately that it's becoming harder than ever to get new leads by giving away free stuff. In this Business Strategy article by Westernston, they talk about giving away free stuff... How and why it often is a horrible business strategy.
And also about the two inviolate rules of giving away free stuff if you must do it.
Why stunts should be part of your marketing strategy:
A look back at notable experiential PR stunts from the last 20 years.

Since 2006, Tanga has been a leader in daily deals. For the past two years in a row, Tanga has been named to Inc 5000’s list of fastest-growing companies in the U.S. This spring Tanga converted to a full-fledged marketplace, specializing in matching products to people.I'm proud of what this completely bootstrapped company and our band of Tanganites have achieved:- Named 14th Fastest Growing Company in Arizona in 2015- Named to Inc 5000 Magazine's list of fastest-growing companies for 2nd year in a row in 2015- Over 5 million orders shipped- More than 2 million customers served- Saved Tanganites over $500 million off list pricesIt's been an honor to work with the employees, vendor partners, and devoted customers that have helped us grow.

Our third division, LOLShirts.com, is a comedic t-shirt retailer. Shirt concepts are created and designed in house, and made by a vendor partner. LOL Shirts leverages flash sales and daily deals sporadically.

A second division of the Tanga Network, BelleChic.com, sells unique non-generic handmade artisan goods in a flash sale format, most of which is in the form of jewelry, with additional sales in home/garden and bath/body type goods. Belle Chic does leverage flash sales on occasion. All of Belle Chic’s orders are fulfilled via drop-shippers.

After dabbling in Internet hosting and analytics, Jeremy decided to go old school and started three franchised Platos Closet stores in northern Utah with his brother Jason. They continue to run today and do over 4 million dollars in annual revenue.

I also started two board game companies, Uberplay which took very popular games from Europe and produced them in English language versions and sold them through the hobby and comic book channels in the United States.

The Cystic Fibrosis Foundation will honor 10 professionals within the Beehive State at the first annual Utah's Finest held at La Caille on Aug. 22."This event will include many people newly associated with the organization,"​ said Ashley Peterson, special events manager for the Cystic Fibrosis Foundation. "The dinner is in recognition of our 10 honorees."​The honorees are from a variety of businesses and organizations within the state. The recognized individuals make a difference in the community as they exemplify leadership qualities, actively volunteer and excel in the business community.Honorees include: Bryan Allred of Sysco Intermountain Food Services, Sydney Elfervig of KSL TV, Brad Jowers of Fiji Water, Josh Lichty of Zions Bank, Lisa Miller of Clear Channel Communications, Jamie Morgan of Jordan School District, Nicolle Solden of Windermere, Brian Swan of Assist2Sell, Allison Watt of Ogden Eccles Conference Center and Jeremy Young of Simplyfun.com."The event was designed to highlight up and coming young professionals who are real go-getters in the community,"​ Peterson said. "They have each agreed to fundraise $3,000 for the Cystic Fibrosis Foundation as Honorees."

recommendations: March 12, 2014, Jeremy worked with Lynn in the same group

Jeremy has always been loyal, supportive, reliable and steady.  When challenges come along, he is at his best.  In the good times, he always underplayed his role.  He’s much more likely to use the word “we” than “I”.  He is a leader with great vision and tenacity who can make complex projects achievable.  He’s also a team player, and knows how to attract, support and inspire great people.  Jeremy puts fairness above self-interest, and would always choose a long-term relationship over short-term personal gain.  He’s the kind of friend that anyone would be lucky to have; the kind of leader that you may only meet a few times in your life.  I’m proud and honored to consider him a friend.  Also, I miss his Christmas cards.

March 12, 2014, Shlomo worked with Jeremy but at different companies

“In matters of style, swim with the current; in matters of principle, stand like a rock.”~Thomas JeffersonIt's been said that great leaders of character formulate their lives upon simple principles. I have known Jeremy for several years, and throughout that time, I have seen firsthand the principles on which he has built his life, both personal and professional; honesty, truth and benevolence. Since I have become acquainted with him, I continue to be impressed with his integrity, work ethic, community spirit and trustworthiness. The friendship and business relationship that we have forged over these past few years have been mutually beneficial, as well as a boon to our respective organizations.I have had the pleasure to work professionally with him on several projects over the past few years. In all that time, Jeremy has acted in an honest, ethical and forthright manner. With masterful leadership, patience and a generosity of spirit, he manages to strengthen and deepen business ties to the parties involved. Beyond his extraordinary skills, he has been the touchstone for what is the right thing to do.I would like to applaud his accomplishments and extend my best wishes for his continued success in all his undertakings.

summary: Jeremy Young, Tanga’s founder and CEO, has built from scratch one the fastest-growing privately-held companies in Arizona (#14 2015 ACE Awards) and the largest bootstrapped company in its market, with no outside investors or debt. The company has grown 241% in the past three years and has been named to the Inc 5000 list of fastest growing privately-held companies three years in a row (2014-2016). Tanga was honored by Phoenix Business Journal in 2014 and 2015 as one of Arizona’s 25 fastest growing private companies and included in the Internet Retailer's lists of Top 1000 ecommerce companies. In May this year, Jeremy Young was named the 2016 CEO of the Year by Phoenix Business Journal at the AZ Top Tech Exec Awards.
name: Jeremy Young
